text: Climate change is real.
It is happening faster than ever,
and it impacts all corners of our society.
Individual consumers, startups, developers, politicians,
and everyone else who shares this beautiful planet with us,
all have a stake in addressing climate change.
And many are working on innovations to slow climate change.
For example, here in Iceland where I am today,
almost 100 percent of electricity consumed in the country
comes from renewable energy.
At Amazon, we believe we must play a critical role
in addressing climate change.
Our resolve is driven by science,
and the science tells us that we have a limited window to act.
Therefore, we co-founded the Climate Pledge —
an effort to reach net-zero carbon emissions across our operations
by 2040, 10 years ahead of the Paris Agreement.
At AWS, we believe technology can be part of the solution.
We’re making advances on many levels,
all the way down to designing our own custom processors,
such as the Graviton — the most power efficient processor from AWS.
With the world’s increasing need for compute
and other IT infrastructure,
innovations like this will be critical
to assuring we can sustainably power the workloads of the future.
We also believe that the cloud can enable other companies
to play a role.
See, technology is nothing without technologists.
It’s the builders –
the developers, engineers, and big thinkers –
who put technology to work to solve these hard, human problems.
I love talking with the builders out there
who innovate in ways never thought possible.
The ones who push the boundaries, to solve complex problems,
and aren’t fearful to take on massive challenges.
We want to share the stories of the heroes
taking on this important work.
This is “Climate Next”,
a video series that focuses on people
using the cloud to fight climate change.
The organizations in these videos are climate solvers.
They are working relentlessly
to address issues related to the warming of our planet.
We want to shine a light on these innovators
and their tenacity, their resolve,
and their creative use of technology.
Let’s find out more from them
and the important work that they are driving.
